{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3568171,"name":"M","username":"Mako","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mako/{size}/265816_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T17:08:43.030Z","cooked":"

Hey, CD I want to know what experiences y’all had with either swerve so that our team can get a first-hand opinion with either swerve. We will switch to swerve this off-season. We are also a returning team and plan to run neos with both swerves. Any issues with assembly troubleshooting designs for custom parts and the availability of parts. Anything would be good to know about your team’s experiences.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T17:08:43.030Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":22,"reads":200,"readers_count":199,"score":150.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496879,"topic_slug":"ttb-swerve-vs-wcp-swerve-x2i","display_username":"M","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"Regular","title_is_group":false,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68890,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"D/N/A"},"post_url":"/t/ttb-swerve-vs-wcp-swerve-x2i/496879/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568265,"name":"","username":"Soren_1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/soren_1/{size}/262420_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T18:09:38.265Z","cooked":"

My team used X2i modules this season and we loved it! The assembly was very smooth, we had groups of 2 people per module with myself and a teammate overseeing them to make sure everything was going together correctly. The instructions were pretty good and we were able to get the swerves put together in 1 meeting (under 3 hours). The pre-glued magnet is very helpful and prevents the headache that is finding out someone didn’t glue the magnet properly after debugging darn near everything else. The assembly videos by First in Michigan are also helpful if there’s any confusion with how it comes together, and also has helpful reminders like using loctite and greasing gears.
The modules ran smoothly for both events and the molded tread held up excellently, we only needed 1 set per event (although we did replace for playoffs at ventura because we played a lot of practice matches on Friday and wanted to get good grip for our playoff run)
One thing I will note is that the 3d printed zeroing tool on WCP’s website is not the easiest thing to use, the flat side on the forks are pretty small and it’s hard to tell when its perfectly squared to the tool. Luckily, once you zero them you shouldn’t have to again even if you disassemble and reassemble them.

There are unused tapped holes on the top plate of the modules and are very handy for mounting mechanisms or supports to them. We put a 1x1 and used it to mount our algae intake plates.
